He also has experience in management consulting gained from his work at McKinsey & Company.

Jukka’s 13-year career with Hewlett Packard mirrors the many fundamental changes that the IT industry has undergone since the early 1980s â€“ from the development, marketing and deployment of proprietary IT technologies through the adoption of open technologies in software to the emphasis on IT consulting and systems integration services.

As general manager for Mobile Software Solutions in Nokia Networks, Jukka was responsible for leading and managing a business unit with world-wide operations and a focus on helping mobile operators to develop, launch and manage new mobile end-user services.

Jukka holds an M.Sc. in Industrial Economics and Computer Sciences from the Helsinki University of Technology.
